movieReview: A good interview with a terrible man.  I have no idea why this movie is controversial nor why it had trouble getting distribution.
A biography of George Lazenby, with funny reenactments of the stories George tells on camera.
Had some friends over who had never seen this so obviously it was a must play.  Still so great.
This was bleak as fuck, but Joachim put in a killer performance and it was not as bad as I feared.  Leaned WAAAAY too heavy into early Scorsese territory tho..
This was super meh.  Lacked tension despite the subject matter and the celebrity 'cameos' were super distracting.
Perhaps I could tolerate a self-indulgent piece of shit if it weren't 9 hours long.

This was fine, but I understand why it was released in January.  There's really nothing special about it.  And it's far too long. There's an entire subplot which, while on it's own was moving, really didn't add much to the film.
Classic David Lynch...  I'm glad this found a home.
While this movie was surprising, I'm not sure I actually liked it.
An interesting look at a legendary Silicon Valley failure that predicted the future.  A bit too long.
This was OK; very pretty but dragged a bit...
It was so wonderful seeing this at the Coolidge in the big house on 35mm with hundreds of others...
Very good.  Made my list of films to watch longer.
movieTitle: Horror Noire: A History of Black Horror

movieReview: This was a nice, solid crime film.  The performances were all solid and the story was good.
What a story.
This was a nice film.  It wasn't amazing, covered territory I feel has been covered before, but did it well and was beautifully shot.
movieTitle: Portrait of a Lady on Fire

movieReview: This was exactly what you want from a movie like this.  Is it special?  No.  But it does exactly the job it set out to do, and did it very well.
This was a fascinating story..  Perhaps it could have been a bit shorter, the middle 3rd felt a bit draggy, but the last 3rd ramped way the hell up and was great.

I saw this MST3K riff in Lowell... I'm pretty sure I watched this movie as a kid but didn't remember it much...  It was a real turd, so really perfect for MST3K...  This was also (theoretically) Joel's last tour, so I'm glad I caught it (even though the prospect of leaving the house so soon after PAX was daunting)
This was better than I expected, a solid little horror-thriller, which actually did offer a bit of a new twist on the story.
A competent film but not all that much save some great performances.
Quite good.  I could have done without the "talking to camera" in place of voiceovers, but overall it was tight and well acted.

I had never gotten around to this one...  People had spoken so highly of it, I guess maybe my expectations were too high...  Denzel was so mustache-twirly and I've never been fond of Ethan Hawke.  It was OK, but I wasn't missing anything.
Ridiculous but good enough for a random quarantine Saturday...
Pretty solid doc about The Band and specifically Robbie Robertson.  Too bad it was made after so many band members passed...
movieTitle: Once Were Brothers: Robbie Robertson and The Band

movieReview: This was a real surprise!  A nice thriller that caught me way off guard.
I spent a ton of time at Other Music, especially the Harvard Square shop...
I didn't know Al Adamson as a name, but I've seen a few of his films.  I knew NOTHING about his life or death.
movieTitle: Blood & Flesh: The Reel Life & Ghastly Death of Al Adamson

movieReview: Having listened to the audiobook, this was covering a bunch of the same ground, but it was still fun and the boys are so engaging that I was right there.
This was good fun.  Good little gags, commitment to the premise, not over the top.

This was an interesting look at several aspects of the Biosphere 2 project.  I only really remembered some sensationalist aspects of the project, but it was interesting to learn more about the totality of it.  That said, it could have lost about 20m.
This was supremely mediocre.
So many lost years of research due to dumb policy.
movieTitle: Have a Good Trip: Adventures in Psychedelics

movieReview: It was OK, but it's one of those movies where basically every speaking character is a crook.
Saw this as part of an IFFBoston virtual screening...  All religion seems a bit weird to me, so it's hard for me to judge how strange proselytizing Judaism is relative to the rest of Judaism.

This was quite good, and surprising... I guess I wasn't expecting what it was, but then again, I went in pretty blind... I only knew the very broad strokes..

And finally a film that didn't feel compelled to tart up it's actors with makeup or digital de-aging as if we can't handle suspension of disbelief.
This turd isn't even worth reviewing.
A look at public funding of stadiums, specifically the new Rangers stadium in Texas, which is replacing a stadium from the 90s.
movieTitle: Throw A Billion Dollars from the Helicopter

movieReview: Even though I’m not a fan of musicals, I felt like I needed to watch this as it’s such a huge part of our culture.  It was fine, the rap helped make it more bearable, but it was definitely a musical.
Great look at the musical Zelig of 70s and 80s music and screen.
movieTitle: Michael Des Barres: Who Do You Want Me to Be?

movieReview: A revenge drama that was brutal in ways that didn't always work for me.
A great history of Spike & Mike’s festivals
I'm an enormous Queen fan but have no interest in Queen + Adam Lambert.  That said, I still watched this documentary.  You should not.
movieTitle: The Show Must Go On: The Queen + Adam Lambert Story

movieReview: Documents the efforts by a group of Dartmouth students to get the LoC or change the “Illegal Alien” subject heading.  Could have been shorter, but otherwise interesting.
Probably only interesting to me lol
Family wanted to re-watch this, so we did.  It's fine, but it was actually not as good as I remembered...  It's not bad, but it thudded more for me this time.
I had seen this before, but hadn't really thought about it in the intervening time...  It was better than I had remembered, but still too long.
This isn't the first documentary covering this topic, but it's one of the best ones I've seen.
Still completely wonderful.
So good. I can’t believe I haven’t revisited this more.
Had the pleasure of sharing this with the family, so good!
A dad-assed dad movie, but not a bad one.
I’m such a sucker for docs like this lol
movieTitle: Live from the Space Stage: A HALYX Story

movieReview: This was a fairly straight-ahead "Behind the Music" style doc (though with the drama turned down to normal levels).  Real good!
This has to be one of the best sequels....  it expands the world without repeating the first film. The ensemble is stronger and the story broader.
Revisited my childhood. Wonderful.
An amazingly wholesome and fun comedy. It’s remarkable how there is really no villain and how the buddies in this buddy comedy are more or less the same.
It is so weird for a movie like this to exist today. A nice, goofy, hopeful distraction
I hadn’t been excited to see this despite buying the disc months ago. This was my first viewing since the theatre. It’s still pretty not great.
movieTitle: Star Wars: Episode IX - The Rise of Skywalker

movieReview: For some reason Corinna really wanted to watch this again. It’s not bad, but I’m not sure I needed to see it again.
I’ve seen or read so many versions of this story that it felt pretty long
I had heard so much about this, but I ended up thinking it was pretty meh... It felt like a mystery where you didn't even know it was a mystery until the end and because of that you didn't care.
What a way to flex the new home theater. Still wonderful.
Pretty fun.... Not as great as the first, but as usually there were some jaw dropping scenes.
A touching family drama.
A gem from IFFBoston...  Will likely be lazily compared to PARASITE, but I found this much more engaging.
This kind of movie is why I love IFFBoston.  I don't think a prison drama about storytelling with fantastical elements would have caught my eye, but I really liked this!
I kickstarted this movie years ago, and it was great to finally see it.  I'm a Zappa dilletant, admiring from afar and enjoying a handful of albums with ignorance of the rest.
I really enjoyed this....  I look forward to recommending it to my friends when it shows up on Amazon (or, gasp, in theatres).
This was my least favorite Fall Focus film...  Seemed to go nowhere and felt slow getting there even though it was only 80m.
This was very good:  surreal and weird but ultimately still a love story.  Reminded me of Jeunet.
May have been my favorite film in the Fall Focus!  I didn't know anything about it going in, even a log line, and was truly surprised at where it went.
I simply didn't connect with this one...  I don't know if it's me, the film, or the current level of noise in the world, but it just didn't land for me.
I have to be honest that watching this on election day was a bad plan.  I had tons of trouble focusing.
I had been thinking of this movie recently, and for whatever reason Coco suggested we watch it as a way to stop doomscrolling for 2 hours.  It's still really good!
Still the best.  Such a great election palate cleanser.
This was clearly a good idea on paper, and it was okay in execution, but it never quite clicked.
A surprise documentary from Werner Herzog on Meteorites?? Fuck yes.
I was jonesing for a space movie, and hadn't seen this one since it was relatively new.  It was a little better than I remembered, though it was definitely a bit long and corny.
This was dumb. But fun.
This was not the first documentary I've seen on this subject, but it was a pretty good one.
Fascinating and heart wrenching
Never got around to this despite seeing the first two in theaters. I chose wisely. It was fine, and I’m glad to have it off my plate, but I wasn’t missing much. Looked great in 4K HDR tho.
movieTitle: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies

movieReview: An biopic is a surprising turn for Fincher...  It seems like both a small and a large story at the same time.  Suffers from some of the 'inside baseball' that bothers me of all films about Hollywood, but overall I enjoyed it.
I am finally plowing thru the last handful of HP films I have yet to watch.  This was fine.  To be honest I'm just kind of trying to get thru lol.
movieTitle: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

movieReview: This at least felt like it had some momentum, which some of these films have lacked.  I'm curious to see how it all wraps up.  I also cant figure out why wizard spell fights seem so stupid yet lightsaber fights are cool as hell.
movieTitle: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1

movieReview:
It's finally done.  Almost a decade after the films ended I finally got around to watching them all.  To be honest, I thought on this side of it i'd have a bunch of valuable cultural context I didn't have before, but I'm not so sure that's the case.  I think I picked up the most significant context via cultural osmosis by this point.  That said, at least I can say I'm done.

The movie was fine.
movieTitle: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 2

movieReview: This had a sci-Fi plot that was “neat” but super hand waved. It felt a bit soulless but was very pretty and mostly engaging. Too mumbly at times.
I can't say I was super interested in the Bee Gees, but this was a very solid rock doc..
movieTitle: The Bee Gees: How Can You Mend a Broken Heart

movieReview: First up in the Christmas lineup
Took me awhile to come around on this one but it’s sweet.
Always a riot
Every time I think I might be getting over this one i come back around
One of the few movies Will Ferrell actually carries
Eh. More consistent than the first one.
This was.... not great.  It was fine in a "time elapsing" sense, but it was pretty dumb.
This was OK, but I think I had my expectations too high.
movieTitle: The Personal History of David Copperfield

movieReview: I didn't know this movie existed until my mother-in-law mentioned she had been wanting to see it and couldn't find it anywhere.  I grabbed it and we watched it.  It was ok, but kind of a slow pace...  Not as engaging as other Le Carre.
